snippet: Scientists say a meteorite that landed in Morocco last year is full of black glass and trapped noble gases, and probably broke off from the Red Planet about 700,000 years ago.
abstract: Dr Hasnaa Chennaoui Aoudjehane study in journal Science reports that meteorite that landed in the Moroccan desert in summer 2011 was ejected from the surface of Mars 700,000 years ago.
lead_paragraph: Scientists say a meteorite that landed in Morocco last year is full of black glass and trapped noble gases, and probably broke off from the Red Planet about 700,000 years ago.

headline.print_headline: A 700,000-Year Trip From Mars to Morocco
headline.seo: Tissint Meteorite From Mars Is 700,000 Years Old
headline.main: A 700,000-Year Trip From Mars to Morocco
